data.citation: Song of the Three Young Men, 29-34
data.label: Canticle 2: A Song of Praise

value.halfverse: praised and exalted above all for ever.
value.verse: Blessed art thou, O Lord God of our fathers; *

value.halfverse: praised and exalted above all for ever.
value.verse: Blessed art thou for the name of thy Majesty; *

value.halfverse: praised and exalted above all for ever.
value.verse: Blessed art thou in the temple of thy holiness; *

value.halfverse: praised and exalted above all for ever.
value.verse:
Blessed art thou that beholdest the depths,
and dwellest between the Cherubim; *
Blessed art thou on the glorious throne of thy kingdom; *
value.halfverse: praised and exalted above all for ever.
praised and exalted above all for ever.
value.verse: Blessed art thou in the firmament of heaven; *

value.halfverse: praised and exalted above all for ever.
value.verse: Blessed art thou, O Father, Son, and Holy Spirit; *
